Taxon name.Name: Rhodococcus ruber
Taxon name.Synonymy: Current name: Rhodococcus ruber (Kruse 1896) Goodfellow and Alderson 1977 (Approved Lists 1980) emend. Nouioui et al. 2018 MB#

Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: documents providing proof of legal access and terms of use available at the collection
Isolator: Water, spring, oilfield outline zone, Perm region, Russia
Metabolites production: Produces biosurfactants when growing on n-hexadecane; transforms β-sytosterol to stigmast-4-en-3-one; transforms thioanisole to methyl phenyl sulfoxide.
Applications: Uses propane and n-butane as a sole carbon source; degrades dibutylphthalate; resistant to lincomycin, methicillin, oxacillin, polymyxin, cephalexin and nalidixic acid when growing on propane and n-hexadecane; grows on medium with 10 mM cadmium; transforms thioanisole; degrades paracetamol and meloxicam; resistant to VO2+ (12.5 mM), VO43- (100.0 mM), VO3- (>250.0 mM); produces biosurfactants when growing on n-hexadecane; uses n-hexadecane as a sole carbon source; accumulates nickel.
